intro: Woodia marginata, commonly known as the marginated woodia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features palmate leaves with a distinctive white margin, and its showy flowers are typically pink or red. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires partial to full sunlight. Woodia marginata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
